The audience is primarily leaders (CTOs, CIOs, IT managers) rather than practitioners or Product Developers themselves. Core topics such as Sprint Backlog, Definition of Done, or integration with Product Owner/Scrum Master are entirely absent. There is only the most tangential relevance—autonomous teams could theoretically include Product Developers, but this is never specified or explored.
Product Developer.reasoning_summary: This content focuses on leadership and organizational scaling, not the Product Developer role or its accountability. It does not mention or analyze Product Developers, nor does it explore themes exclusive to that category, making it a poor fit.

Objective Key Results.reasoning_summary: This content addresses organizational scaling and leadership without referencing Objective Key Results or their principles.
